CREDIT FACILITIES AGREEMENT

DATED [●] 202[●]

BETWEEN:

(1) [BORROWER NAME] (the "Borrower");

(2) THE FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS LISTED IN PART 1 (THE LENDERS) OF SCHEDULE 1 (the "Original Lenders"); and

(3) [BANK NAME] as administrative agent and security agent (the "Agent").

WHEREAS:
(A) The Borrower has requested that the Lenders make available to it a senior secured revolving credit facility and term loan facility for the purposes set out in this Agreement.
(B) The Lenders have agreed to make those facilities available on the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement.

IT IS AGREED:

1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
1.1 Definitions
In this Agreement:

"Affiliate" means, in relation to any person, any subsidiary or holding company of that person, and any subsidiary of any holding company of that person.

"Applicable Margin" means, in relation to any Loan, the margin specified in Clause 6.2 (Interest Margin) as adjusted in accordance with Schedule 15 (Sustainability Linked Adjustment).

"Availability Period" means the period from and including the date of this Agreement to and including the earlier of (a) the date falling 12 months after the date of this Agreement and (b) the last day of the Termination Date.

"Business Day" means a day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks are open for general business in London and New York.

"Commitment" means:
(a) in relation to a Lender, the amount set opposite its name under the heading "Commitment" in Part 1 of Schedule 1, to the extent not cancelled, reduced or transferred; and
(b) in relation to any New Lender, the amount of its commitment as set out in the relevant Transfer Certificate or Assignment Agreement.

"Compliance Certificate" means a certificate substantially in the form set out in Schedule 10.

"Consolidated EBITDA" means, for any Relevant Period, the consolidated net income of the Group before deduction of (a) interest, (b) tax, (c) depreciation and amortisation, calculated in accordance with GAAP; provided that Consolidated EBITDA shall be calculated without adding back any extraordinary items, non-recurring restructuring charges, or synergies unless expressly approved in writing by the Majority Lenders.

"Debt Service" means, for any Relevant Period, the aggregate amount of (a) scheduled principal repayments and (b) interest payments, in each case actually paid or payable by the Group during such Relevant Period.

"Debt Service Cover Ratio" or "DSCR" means, for any Relevant Period, the ratio of (i) Cash Flow Available for Debt Service to (ii) Debt Service.

"Default" means an Event of Default or any event or circumstance specified in Clause 14 (Events of Default) which would (with the expiry of a grace period, giving of notice, the making of any determination or any combination of any of the foregoing) be an Event of Default.

"Environmental and Social Report" means the report delivered by the Borrower to the Agent pursuant to Clause 11.7 (Sustainability Information).

"ESG KPI" means the metric defined as the absolute reduction in Scope 1 and Scope 2 Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Emissions across the Borrower's global operations, measured in metric tons of CO2 equivalent, verified by an External Reviewer annually.

"External Reviewer" means an external auditor or assurance provider of recognised standing appointed by the Borrower (acting reasonably) and approved by the Agent (acting reasonably).

"Facility" means the Revolving Facility and/or the Term Facility, as the context requires.

"Finance Documents" means this Agreement, any Accession Letter, any Transfer Certificate, any Assignment Agreement, any Hedging Confirmation, any fee letters and any other document designated as such by the Agent and the Borrower.

"Finance Parties" means the Agent, the Security Agent, the Arrangers and the Lenders.

"GAAP" means generally accepted accounting principles in the United States, consistently applied.

"Group" means the Borrower and its subsidiaries from time to time.

"Majority Lenders" means a Lender or Lenders whose Commitments aggregate more than 66 2/3 per cent. of the Total Commitments.

"Material Adverse Effect" means a material adverse effect on (a) the business, operations, property, condition (financial or otherwise) or prospects of the Group taken as a whole, or (b) the ability of the Borrower to perform its obligations under the Finance Documents.

"Month End" means the last day of each calendar month.

"Obligor" means the Borrower and any Guarantor.

"Permitted Indebtedness" means:
(a) indebtedness under the Finance Documents;
(b) intra-Group indebtedness permitted under Clause 13.7;
(c) hedging obligations entered into in the ordinary course for risk management; and
(d) other indebtedness not exceeding USD [●] in aggregate outstanding at any time.

"Permitted Transfer" means a transfer or assignment to (a) an existing Lender, (b) an Affiliate of a Lender, or (c) an Approved Fund.

"Quarter Date" means each of 31 March, 30 June, 30 September and 31 December.

"Relevant Period" means each period of four consecutive fiscal quarters ending on a Quarter Date.

"Sanctions" means economic or financial sanctions laws and regulations administered by the United Kingdom, the European Union, the United States or the United Nations.

"Sanctioned Jurisdiction" means any country or territory that is the subject of country-wide or territory-wide Sanctions.

"Sanctioned Person" means any person listed on, or owned or controlled by a person listed on, a Sanctions-related list maintained by any competent authority under Sanctions.

"Sustainability Performance Target" or "SPT" means the target for the ESG KPI set out in Schedule 15.

"Total Commitments" means the aggregate of the Commitments.

1.2 Construction
References to a "Clause" or "Schedule" are to clauses of and schedules to this Agreement.

2. THE FACILITIES
2.1 The Revolving Facility
Subject to the terms of this Agreement, the Lenders make available to the Borrower a revolving credit facility in an aggregate principal amount of USD [●] (the "Revolving Facility").

2.2 The Term Facility
Subject to the terms of this Agreement, the Lenders make available to the Borrower a term loan facility in an aggregate principal amount of USD [●] (the "Term Facility").

2.3 Purpose
The Borrower shall apply all Utilisations for the purposes of (a) working capital and general corporate purposes of the Group and (b) permitted acquisitions in accordance with Clause 13.6.

3. CONDITIONS OF UTILISATION
3.1 Initial conditions precedent
The Lenders will not be obliged to comply with Clause 4 (Utilisation) unless the Agent has received in form and substance satisfactory to it:
(a) constitutional documents of each Obligor;
(b) board resolutions and incumbency certificates;
(c) legal opinions (jurisdictions: [●]);
(d) evidence of authority for signatories;
(e) evidence of insurance;
(f) the Original Financial Statements;
(g) KYC information for the Obligors;
(h) a funds flow statement for the initial Utilisation;
(i) evidence that the Security is perfected or will be perfected in accordance with an agreed timetable.

3.2 Further conditions precedent
The Borrower may not deliver a Utilisation Request unless:
(a) no Default is continuing or would result;
(b) the representations are true in all material respects;
(c) the requested drawing complies with the Availability Period and the utilisation limits.

4. UTILISATION
4.1 Utilisation Request
The Borrower may utilise a Facility by delivering a Utilisation Request to the Agent not later than [●] Business Days before the proposed Utilisation Date.

4.2 Amount
The amount of each Utilisation shall be not less than USD [●] and, if greater, in integral multiples of USD [●].

5. REPAYMENT AND PREPAYMENT
5.1 Repayment of Revolving Facility
The Borrower shall repay each Revolving Loan on the last day of its Interest Period.

5.2 Amortisation of Term Facility
The Borrower shall repay the Term Facility in quarterly instalments as set out in Schedule 6.

5.3 Mandatory prepayment
The Borrower shall prepay the Facilities from (a) asset sale proceeds exceeding USD [●] per fiscal year, (b) insurance proceeds, and (c) proceeds of any issuance of debt not permitted as Permitted Indebtedness.

6. INTEREST
6.1 Interest calculation
Interest accrues on each Loan from day to day at the applicable rate.

6.2 Interest Margin
The Applicable Margin shall be [●]% per annum, as adjusted under Schedule 15.

7. FEES
7.1 Commitment fee
The Borrower shall pay a commitment fee on the undrawn Revolving Facility at [●]% per annum.

7.2 Agency and arrangement fees
The Borrower shall pay the Agent and Arrangers the fees set out in the fee letter.

8. TAX GROSS-UP AND INDEMNITIES
8.1 Tax gross-up
All payments under the Finance Documents shall be made free and clear of withholding tax unless required by law.

8.2 FATCA and other withholding administration
(a) Each Finance Party shall, within a reasonable time of request by the Agent or the Borrower, provide any documentation or information reasonably required to enable the Borrower or the Agent to determine whether any withholding tax (including under FATCA) is required in respect of any payment under a Finance Document and, if so, the amount of such withholding.
(b) If a Finance Party fails to provide documentation or information under paragraph (a), the Borrower may withhold any amounts required by law and shall not be required to gross-up to the extent that such withholding would not have been required if the Finance Party had provided the documentation or information.
(c) Nothing in this Clause 8.2 requires any Finance Party to provide information that it is prohibited from disclosing by applicable law or that would cause it to breach any duty of confidentiality owed to a third party.

9. INCREASED COSTS
9.1 Increased costs
The Borrower shall indemnify each Finance Party for increased costs incurred as a result of changes in law or regulation.

9.2 Illegality
(a) If it becomes unlawful in any applicable jurisdiction for a Lender to perform any of its obligations as contemplated by this Agreement (including to fund, maintain, or give effect to a Loan), that Lender shall promptly notify the Agent.
(b) Upon notification under paragraph (a), the Agent shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, consult with the Borrower and the relevant Lender to agree a lawful alternative. If no lawful alternative is available within a reasonable period, the relevant Lender’s Commitment shall be cancelled and the Borrower shall, if requested by that Lender, prepay that Lender’s participation in the relevant Loan together with accrued interest and all other amounts due to that Lender.
(c) No Lender shall be required to take any action that it reasonably determines would be unlawful or materially prejudicial to it.

9.3 Market disruption and rate fallback trigger
(a) If the Agent determines (acting reasonably) that:
    (i) the cost to one or more Lenders of funding a Loan exceeds the applicable reference rate in a manner that is material; or
    (ii) the reference rate is not representative or cannot be determined for an Interest Period,
then the Agent may notify the Borrower and the Lenders that this Clause 9.3 applies.
(b) While this Clause 9.3 applies, the interest rate for affected Loans shall be the cost of funds (as reasonably notified by the relevant Lenders to the Agent) plus the Applicable Margin, unless the Agent and the Borrower agree an alternative fallback within a reasonable period.
(c) The Agent shall consult with the Borrower in good faith to minimise disruption and to transition to an agreed replacement rate or fallback.

10. REPRESENTATIONS
The Borrower makes the representations in this Clause 10 on the date of this Agreement and on each Utilisation Date.

10.1 Status
Each Obligor is duly incorporated and validly existing.

10.2 Power and authority
Each Obligor has the power to enter into and perform the Finance Documents.

10.3 No conflict
No Finance Document conflicts with any law or material agreement.

10.4 Financial statements
The Original Financial Statements were prepared in accordance with GAAP and give a true and fair view in all material respects.

10.5 No material adverse change
Since the date of the Original Financial Statements there has been no Material Adverse Effect.

10.6 Litigation
No litigation is current or threatened which might have a Material Adverse Effect.

11. INFORMATION UNDERTAKINGS
The Borrower undertakes that it shall supply to the Agent:

11.1 Financial statements
As soon as available, but in any event within 120 days after the end of each financial year, its audited consolidated financial statements.

11.2 Quarterly management accounts
Within 45 days after each Quarter Date, its unaudited consolidated management accounts.

11.3 Compliance Certificate
Together with each set of financial statements delivered under Clauses 11.1 and 11.2, a Compliance Certificate setting out (in reasonable detail) computations as to compliance with Clause 12 (Financial Covenants).

11.4 Budgets
No later than 30 days prior to the start of each financial year, an annual budget.

11.5 Notices
Promptly upon becoming aware, notice of (a) any Default, (b) any litigation reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect, and (c) any event that has or is reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect.

11.6 Lender meetings
Upon request of the Agent, reasonable access for meetings and discussions.

11.7 Sustainability information
Within 150 days of each financial year end:
(a) an Environmental and Social Report including the ESG KPI calculation and the SPT result for the relevant Test Period;
(b) an assurance statement from the External Reviewer.

12. FINANCIAL COVENANTS
12.1 Minimum DSCR
The Borrower shall ensure that the DSCR in respect of any Relevant Period ending on a Quarter Date shall not be less than 1.20:1.00.

12.2 Testing frequency
The Financial Covenants shall be calculated and tested quarterly on a rolling 12-month basis.

12.3 Reporting basis
The Financial Covenants shall be calculated on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP.

13. GENERAL UNDERTAKINGS
The Borrower undertakes that it shall:

13.1 Authorisations
Obtain and comply with all authorisations required for its business.

13.2 Compliance with laws
Comply with all applicable laws in all material respects.

13.3 Insurance
Maintain insurance with reputable insurers.

13.4 Pari passu and negative pledge
Ensure the obligations under the Finance Documents rank at least pari passu with all other unsecured and unsubordinated obligations, subject to permitted security.

13.5 Disposals
Not dispose of assets except as permitted under Clause 13.5(a)-(d).

13.6 Acquisitions
Not make acquisitions except permitted acquisitions not exceeding USD [●] per year.

13.7 Indebtedness
Not incur or permit to remain outstanding any Indebtedness other than Permitted Indebtedness.

13.8 Dividends and distributions
Not declare or pay any distribution unless (a) no Default is continuing and (b) the pro forma DSCR is at least 1.35:1.00.

13.9 Sanctions, AML and KYC
(a) The Borrower shall (and shall procure that each member of the Group shall):
    (i) comply in all material respects with applicable anti-money laundering, anti-bribery and counter-terrorist financing laws; and
    (ii) maintain policies and procedures designed to promote and achieve such compliance.
(b) The Borrower represents that neither it nor, to its knowledge, any of its directors, officers or controlled affiliates is:
    (i) a Sanctioned Person; or
    (ii) located, organised or resident in a Sanctioned Jurisdiction.
(c) The Borrower shall not use the proceeds of any Utilisation in a manner that would cause any Finance Party to be in breach of Sanctions.
(d) The Borrower shall, promptly upon request by the Agent, provide information and documentation reasonably required by any Finance Party to satisfy its “know your customer” requirements, provided that the Agent shall coordinate such requests to reduce duplication.

14. EVENTS OF DEFAULT
Each of the following is an Event of Default:

14.1 Non-payment
An Obligor fails to pay any amount payable under a Finance Document within [3] Business Days of its due date.

14.2 Financial covenants
Any Financial Covenant is not satisfied.

14.3 Other obligations
An Obligor does not comply with any provision of the Finance Documents and (if capable of remedy) does not remedy within [15] Business Days.

14.4 Misrepresentation
Any representation is incorrect in any material respect when made.

14.5 Insolvency
An Obligor becomes insolvent or unable to pay its debts.

14.6 Cross-default
Any financial indebtedness of an Obligor is declared due and payable prior to its stated maturity.

14.7 Unlawfulness
It becomes unlawful for an Obligor to perform any of its material obligations.

15. THE AGENT
The Agent acts as agent for the Finance Parties.

16. CHANGES TO THE LENDERS
16.1 Assignments and transfers
Subject to this Clause 16, a Lender (the "Existing Lender") may assign any of its rights or transfer by novation its rights and obligations under the Finance Documents to a New Lender.

16.2 Conditions of assignment
Borrower consent is required for any assignment or transfer unless (i) to another Lender or an Affiliate of a Lender or (ii) made at a time when an Event of Default is continuing. Such consent must not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

16.3 Procedure
A transfer becomes effective only upon the Agent receiving a duly completed Transfer Certificate.

16.4 Minimum transfer amount
(a) A transfer or assignment must be for a minimum amount of not less than USD [●] (or, if less, the entire remaining Commitment of the Existing Lender), unless the Agent otherwise agrees.
(b) An Existing Lender may not transfer or assign part only of its rights and obligations if, after that transfer or assignment, it would have a Commitment of less than USD [●], unless the Agent otherwise agrees.

16.5 Settlement and effectiveness
(a) A transfer or assignment shall not take effect until:
    (i) the Agent has received a duly completed Transfer Certificate or Assignment Agreement; and
    (ii) the Agent has received any required processing or administration fee (if any).
(b) The Agent shall, acting reasonably, record the transfer in its register and notify the Borrower once recorded.
(c) Any transfer or assignment is subject to the New Lender providing KYC information reasonably required by the Agent.

16.6 Register
(a) The Agent shall maintain a register recording the names of the Lenders, their Commitments and any transfers or assignments.
(b) The register shall be prima facie evidence of the matters recorded in it.
(c) A Lender may request an extract of the register relating to its participation.

16.7 Confidentiality
(a) Each Finance Party shall keep confidential all information received by it in connection with the Finance Documents and the Obligors, except:
    (i) with the consent of the Borrower;
    (ii) to the extent required by law or regulation or by a competent authority;
    (iii) to its Affiliates, professional advisers, auditors, insurers and rating agencies, provided they are bound by confidentiality obligations; or
    (iv) to a prospective New Lender in connection with a permitted transfer or assignment, provided that prospective New Lender is subject to confidentiality undertakings.
(b) This Clause 16.7 does not prevent any Finance Party from disclosing information that is or becomes public other than as a result of a breach of this Clause.

16.8 No responsibility for information
No Finance Party makes any representation as to the accuracy or completeness of any information provided by or on behalf of any Obligor. Each New Lender shall make its own independent appraisal and investigation of the financial condition, affairs and creditworthiness of the Group.

17. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by English law.

18. JURISDICTION
The courts of England have exclusive jurisdiction.

19. NOTICES
19.1 Any notice or other communication under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by hand, courier or email to the address and email specified in Schedule [●] (Notices).
19.2 A notice is deemed received:
(a) if delivered by hand or courier, when delivered; and
(b) if sent by email, at the time of transmission provided no delivery failure notice is received, except that any email sent after 5:00 p.m. (London time) on a Business Day or on a non-Business Day is deemed received at 9:00 a.m. on the next Business Day.
19.3 The Agent may rely on communications reasonably appearing to be from an authorised person.

20. CALCULATIONS AND CERTIFICATES
20.1 Any determination or calculation by the Agent under a Finance Document is (in the absence of manifest error) conclusive and binding.
20.2 A certificate signed by the Agent stating the amount at any time due and payable is prima facie evidence of that amount.

21. SET-OFF
A Finance Party may set off any matured obligation of an Obligor due to it under a Finance Document against any matured obligation of that Finance Party owed to an Obligor, to the extent permitted by applicable law.

22. COSTS AND EXPENSES
22.1 The Borrower shall pay (or reimburse) the Agent’s reasonable costs and expenses (including legal fees) incurred in connection with:
(a) the negotiation, execution and enforcement of the Finance Documents; and
(b) any amendment, waiver or consent requested by the Borrower.
22.2 The Borrower shall not be liable for the costs of any Finance Party relating to a transfer or assignment (other than the Agent’s processing fees, if any).

23. BAIL-IN AND RESOLUTION
If a Finance Party is subject to any statutory or regulatory bail-in or resolution powers, the parties acknowledge and accept that liabilities under the Finance Documents may be subject to the exercise of those powers, to the extent permitted by applicable law.

SCHEDULE 10
FORM OF COMPLIANCE CERTIFICATE
[●]

SCHEDULE 15
SUSTAINABILITY LINKED ADJUSTMENT

1. Margin Adjustment
If the Borrower meets the SPT regarding the ESG KPI for the relevant Test Period, the Applicable Margin shall be reduced by 0.05% per annum. If the Borrower fails to meet the SPT, the Applicable Margin shall be increased by 0.05% per annum.

2. KPI Boundary
The ESG KPI shall be calculated strictly based on Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions. Scope 3 emissions (supply chain and downstream) are explicitly excluded.

3. Verification
The External Reviewer shall provide limited assurance over the ESG KPI calculation and SPT outcome.

4. Dispute
If the Agent disputes the calculation in good faith, the parties shall engage the External Reviewer to clarify and, if required, restate the ESG KPI calculation.

AMENDMENT NO. 3
TO
CREDIT FACILITIES AGREEMENT

DATED [●] 202[●]

THIS AMENDMENT NO. 3 (this "Amendment") is made on [●] 202[●]

BETWEEN:

(1) [BORROWER NAME] (the "Borrower");

(2) THE LENDERS party hereto; and

(3) [BANK NAME], as Agent.

BACKGROUND
(A) The Borrower, the Lenders and the Agent entered into a credit facilities agreement dated [●] 202[●] (the "Credit Agreement").
(B) The Borrower has requested amendments to reflect changes in reporting timelines, covenant testing cadence and its sustainability measurement boundary.
(C) The Majority Lenders have consented to the amendments set out below.

1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
1.1 Terms defined in the Credit Agreement have the same meaning in this Amendment unless otherwise defined.

2. AMENDMENTS

2.1 Consolidated EBITDA (Clause 1.1)
The definition of "Consolidated EBITDA" in Clause 1.1 is deleted and replaced with:

"Consolidated EBITDA" means, for any Relevant Period, the consolidated net income of the Group before deduction of (a) interest, (b) tax, (c) depreciation and amortisation, calculated in accordance with GAAP; plus (d) one-time restructuring charges, severance costs and business optimisation expenses incurred during such period, provided that (i) the aggregate amount of such add-backs shall not exceed 15% of Consolidated EBITDA and (ii) any add-back in excess of USD [●] in any fiscal year is subject to Agent review (acting reasonably).

2.2 ESG KPI boundary (Clause 1.1 and Schedule 15)
(a) The definition of "ESG KPI" is amended by replacing "Scope 1 and Scope 2" with "Scope 1, Scope 2 and Material Scope 3".
(b) Paragraph 2 (KPI Boundary) of Schedule 15 is deleted and replaced with:

"2. KPI Boundary
The ESG KPI shall be calculated based on Scope 1, Scope 2, and Material Scope 3 emissions, including (a) purchased goods and services and (b) use of sold products, in each case to the extent such categories are reasonably measurable using an accepted methodology and are verified by the External Reviewer."

2.3 Financial Statements deadline (Clause 11.1)
Clause 11.1 (Financial statements) is amended by replacing "120 days" with "90 days".

2.4 Minimum DSCR (Clause 12.1)
Clause 12.1 (Minimum DSCR) is amended by replacing "1.20:1.00" with "1.30:1.00".

2.5 Testing frequency (Clause 12.2)
Clause 12.2 (Testing frequency) is deleted and replaced with:

"12.2 Testing frequency
The Financial Covenants shall be calculated and tested monthly as at each Month End on a rolling 12-month basis. Each monthly test shall be delivered with a Compliance Certificate within 20 Business Days of the relevant Month End."

2.6 Conforming changes
References to "Quarter Date" and quarterly delivery in Clause 11.3 (Compliance Certificate) shall be interpreted to include monthly delivery to the extent required to give effect to Clause 12.2 as amended.

2.7 Conforming reporting and certification
(a) Any reference in the Credit Agreement to delivery of a Compliance Certificate “with” quarterly financial statements shall, to the extent inconsistent with Clause 12.2 as amended, be read as requiring monthly delivery within the timeframe specified in Clause 12.2.
(b) The form of Compliance Certificate in Schedule 10 is deemed amended to permit monthly covenant testing and reporting.

3. REPRESENTATIONS
The Borrower represents that:
(a) it has power and authority to enter into this Amendment;
(b) no Default is continuing or would result from this Amendment;
(c) each representation in Clause 10 of the Credit Agreement is true in all material respects as at the date of this Amendment.

4. EFFECTIVENESS
This Amendment shall take effect on the date the Agent notifies the Borrower that it has received:
(a) this Amendment executed by the Borrower and the Majority Lenders; and
(b) a certificate of an authorised signatory of the Borrower confirming the representations in Clause 3.

5. MISCELLANEOUS
5.1 Costs
The Borrower shall pay the reasonable costs of the Agent in connection with this Amendment.

5.2 Governing law
This Amendment is governed by English law.

5.3 Counterparts
This Amendment may be executed in counterparts.

SIGNATURES
[Signature pages follow]
